title: Lee Kuan Yew
summary: Lee Kuan Yew GCMG CH SPMJ DK (16 September 1923 â€“ 23 March 2015), born Harry Lee Kuan Yew, often referred to by his initials LKY and sometimes known in his earlier years as Harry Lee, was a Singaporean statesman and lawyer who served as the first Prime Minister of Singapore between 1959 and 1990, and is widely recognised as the nation's founding father.[2][3] He was also one of the founders of the People's Action Party, which has governed the country continuously since independence.
